alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 10:12AM EDT until April 12 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Cape Fear River At William O Huske Lock And Dam 3 affecting Bladen and Cumberland Counties. Cape Fear River At Elizabethtown affecting Bladen County. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Florence and Darlington Counties. For the Cape Fear River...including William O Huske Lock And Dam 3, Elizabethtown, Lock And Dam 1...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Black Creek Nr Hartsville, Quinby... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Quinby. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Floodwaters continue to rise on Creekside Drive and East Black Creek Road with water nearing a few homes. Homes along East Black Creek Road become isolated and residents must use boats to exit the neighborhood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.1 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by this evening.
